intro: Prangos stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phlomis, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and lavender. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray, narrow leaves and clusters of pale blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Prangos stenoptera is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
